intro: Galium leiophyllum var. glabrum, commonly known as smooth wood-sorrel, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its smooth, glabrous appearance distinguishes it from other varieties of Galium. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
